episodeTitle: Shaking Heaven and Earth! Admiral Fujitora's Power!
episodeTitleJapanese: 天地揺るがす！大将藤虎の実力
episodeTitleRomanized: Tenchi Yurugasu! Taishō Fujitora no Jitsuryoku
description: Admiral Fujitora demonstrates his devastating gravity powers by summoning a meteor. Law faces off against both Fujitora and Doflamingo on Green Bit. Meanwhile, Usopp lies about being a descendant of Noland to the Tontatta dwarves, and Luffy tames the Fighting Bull in the Corrida Colosseum.

events.title: Violet and Sanji Part Ways
events.description: Violet gives Sanji a map to the secret factory before splitting up. Sanji tells her to meet him at the western port so they can escape later. Violet is amused that Sanji still thinks he can save her and smiles before running off.
events.significance: Sets up the complex relationship between Violet and Sanji, hinting at her true loyalties while Sanji remains oblivious to the danger.

quotes.text: Meet me at the western port and hide yourself so that we can escape later.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji trying to save Violet, unaware of her true allegiance

events.title: Sanji Reunites with Kin'emon
events.description: Kin'emon suddenly appears and tells Sanji to defeat a group of Doflamingo's men who were chasing after him. Sanji and Kin'emon reunite after being separated.
events.significance: Reunites two members of the alliance and shows the ongoing pursuit by Doflamingo's forces across Dressrosa.

events.title: Franky Complains About Luffy Fighting
events.description: Franky gets a call from Sanji complaining about letting Luffy enter the Corrida Colosseum tournament. Franky reveals that he let Luffy fight, much to Sanji's frustration. Sanji informs Franky about his feelings for Violet.
events.significance: Shows the ongoing tension about Luffy's decision to fight in the Colosseum, which will have major consequences for the crew's mission.

events.title: Noland's Connection to the Tontatta Dwarves
events.description: Robin realizes that a statue in the Tontatta Kingdom is of Mont Blanc Noland. Leo explains that Noland came to their island 400 years ago and fought with the bad humans that were ravaging their island, leading the dwarves to victory.
events.significance: Reveals that Noland was a hero to the Tontatta dwarves, providing crucial backstory that connects to the Skypiea arc and validates Noland's reputation.

quotes.text: Noland came to our island 400 years ago and fought with the bad humans that were ravaging our island and led the dwarves to victory.
quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.context: Leo explaining Noland's heroic actions to Robin

events.title: Usopp Lies About Being Noland's Descendant
events.description: Usopp lies to the dwarves that he is a descendant of Noland, only for them to ask for his help in defeating the Doflamingo Pirates. The dwarves call him 'Usoland' and treat him as a hero. They proclaim that Usoland will lead them to victory and chant his name, much to Usopp's horror.
events.significance: Usopp's lie traps him into a position of responsibility, forcing him to help the dwarves. This becomes a major turning point in his character development and the Dressrosa conflict.

quotes.text: It was 400 years ago today that Noland led our ancestors to victory and now on the day that we vowed to fight Doflamingo, Usoland the hero showed up!
quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.context: The dwarves believing Usopp is their prophesied hero

events.title: Luffy Tames the Fighting Bull with Haki
events.description: In the Corrida Colosseum, Luffy tames the Fighting Bull nicknamed 'Brutal Bull' Ucy using his Conqueror's Haki. Ucy becomes friendly with Luffy and allows him to ride him during the battle royale.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's growing mastery of Haki and his unique ability to befriend creatures. Shows his strength in subduing a violent gladiator bull.

events.title: Law's Shichibukai Status Revoked
events.description: On Green Bit, Admiral Fujitora officially revokes Trafalgar Law's title as Shichibukai after Law confirms his alliance with the Straw Hats. Fujitora states that Law has lost the protection of the World Government.
events.significance: Major political consequence for Law's alliance with Luffy. This makes Law a wanted pirate again and sets up the confrontation with both Fujitora and Doflamingo.

quotes.text: I hereby revoke your title as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea!
quotes.speaker: Fujitora
quotes.context: Fujitora officially stripping Law of his Shichibukai status

events.title: Fujitora Summons a Meteor from Space
events.description: Admiral Fujitora uses his Zushi Zushi no Mi Devil Fruit powers to summon a massive meteor from outer space, causing it to fall directly toward Green Bit. This demonstrates the devastating scale of his gravity manipulation abilities, shocking both Law and Doflamingo.
events.significance: This is the first time Fujitora's true power is displayed in the anime, establishing him as one of the most dangerous admirals. The meteor attack becomes one of the most iconic moments in the Dressrosa arc.

quotes.text: I was just testing my strength a little.
quotes.speaker: Fujitora
quotes.context: Fujitora's casual response after summoning a meteor from space

events.title: Law, Doflamingo, and Fujitora Cut the Meteor
events.description: As the meteor plummets toward them, Law, Doflamingo, and Fujitora all use their Devil Fruit abilities to slice the meteor into pieces before it can hit them. The falling meteorite pieces create a massive crater around them, leaving only their footholds intact.
events.significance: Demonstrates the incredible power levels of all three fighters. Shows that Law and Doflamingo can respond to admiral-level threats and sets up the three-way confrontation.

quotes.text: I was just testing my strength a little.
quotes.speaker: Fujitora
quotes.context: After summoning a meteor from space

quotes.text: It was 400 years ago today that Noland led our ancestors to victory and now on the day that we vowed to fight Doflamingo, Usoland the hero showed up!
quotes.speaker: Leo
quotes.context: The dwarves believing Usopp is their prophesied hero

quotes.text: I hereby revoke your title as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea!
quotes.speaker: Fujitora
quotes.context: Officially stripping Law of his Shichibukai status

themes.description: The episode explores how power can be overwhelming and the responsibility that comes with it. Fujitora's meteor demonstrates terrifying power, while Usopp is burdened with responsibility he didn't want.
themes.symbolism: The meteor from the sky represents the crushing weight of power and expectations falling on the characters.

themes.description: Noland's legacy as a hero to the dwarves contrasts with his reputation as a liar in most of the world. This explores how history and legends can be interpreted differently.
themes.symbolism: The statue of Noland in the Tontatta Kingdom represents how one person's legacy can vary dramatically based on perspective.
culturalReferences: The Tale of Noland the Liar - Japanese folklore about liars being redeemed

characterSpotlights.development: Fujitora's true capabilities are revealed, establishing him as a fearsome admiral with gravity powers capable of summoning meteors from space.
keyActions: Summons a meteor from outer space
Casually explains he was just testing his strength
quotes: I was just testing my strength a little.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp's lie about being Noland's descendant traps him into a position of leadership for the dwarves, forcing him to step up despite his fear.
keyActions: Is proclaimed as 'Usoland' by the dwarves
Reluctantly accepts the role of leader

characterSpotlights.development: Law faces the consequences of his alliance with the Straw Hats as he loses his Shichibukai status and must face both an admiral and a fellow warlord.
keyActions: Cuts the meteor with his powers

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the meteor scene with additional animation and reaction shots to emphasize the scale of Fujitora's power.
The anime added more dialogue and internal monologue from Usopp about his fear of leading the dwarves.

trivia.fact: This episode features the first time Fujitora's meteor summoning ability is shown in the anime, which became one of the most iconic power demonstrations in One Piece.
The episode aired on May 4, 2014, during Golden Week in Japan, a series of national holidays.
Usopp being called 'Usoland' by the dwarves is a play on his name and Noland's name, creating a portmanteau that the dwarves believe connects them.
This episode covers parts of Chapters 713 and 714, showing the parallel storylines of events happening simultaneously across Dressrosa and Green Bit.
